page.title: 08THE RAILWAY IN BIRSTALL
page.content: The{Great Central Railway}was opened on 1st Jan. 1847 and ran from Manchester to London. The section of line through Birstall was closed in May 1969. Since then, the track, sleepers, signals etc. have been removed. The line has become a haven for wildlife. Foxes have been seen in the early morning along this track. All the bridges are intact and the route is used for walking, exercising dogs, unofficial motorcycling and as a playground. The line near{Rothley Brook}is working and the section of line between Rothley and Birstall is hoping to reopen in 1987. The land is being reclaimed by the{Main Line Steam {Trust,}with the help of Charnwood Borough Council and the Birstall Action Team. Preserved steam trains will soon travel to{Birstall Station.
